gurmukhi: ਦਰਸਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਦਿਬਿ ਦੇਹ ਕੈ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਭੲੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਗ ਦ੍ਰਿਬ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਬਿਖੈ ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਚੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Darasan Dhiaan Dibi Dayh Kai Bidayh Bhaay , Drig Drib Drisati Bikhai Bhaau Bhagati Cheen Hai ?
translation: By the contemplated vision of the True Guru, the Guru-conscious Sikhs become free of ego while still in their body form. By virtue of divine sight of the True Guru, they acquire the wisdom of loving worship.

gurmukhi: ਅਧਿਅਾਤਮ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਤਮ ਪ੍ਵੇਸ ਪਰਮਾਤਮ ਪ੍ਵੇਸ ਸਰਬਾਤਮ ਲਿੳੁ ਲੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Adhiaatam Karam Kari Aatam Pravaysa , Paramaatam Pravays Sarabaatam Liu Leen Hai ?
translation: By virtue of his spiritual knowledge and righteous actions, a follower of Guru finds peace and tranquillity in his self. By becoming one with Lord, he realises the presence of the divine light in the beings.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਪਰਵਾਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਪਾੲੇ ਪਰਮਾਰਥ ਸਬਦਾਰਥ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Giaan Paravaan Hui Nidhaan Paaay , Paramaarad Sabadaarad Prabeen Hai ?
translation: By the knowledge acquired through meditation on divine word, a devoted Sikh is accepted by the Guru who blesses him with the treasure of Lord's Naam. He then becomes wise to understand the principles of spirituality.

gurmukhi: ਤਤੈ ਮਿਲੇ ਤਤ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਕੈ ਪਰਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਰਸ ਬਸਿ ਭੲੇ ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਮੀਨ ਹੈ ॥੧੧੫॥
transliteration: Tatai Milay Tat Jotee Joti Kai Param Joti , Praym Ras Basi Bhaay Jaisay Jal Meen Hai ?115?
translation: As the quintessence merges in its origin and become one; as flame of a beacon becomes one with the other flame, so does the soul of a Guru-conscious person merges with the Supreme soul. He gets so engrossed in the pleasure of Lord's love that he remains i
